intro: Ruschia albida, commonly known as the silver leaf Ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
